Tasks.Task Description: Identify the data types, volume, and retention policies for the archive storage. Determine access frequency and compliance requirements.
Plan the storage architecture, including the use of storage accounts, containers, and access tiers. Ensure scalability and cost optimization.
Provision a new Azure Storage Account with the required configurations, such as region, redundancy, and access tier settings.
Set up the archive tier for the storage account. Define policies for moving data to the archive tier based on access patterns and retention requirements.
Enable encryption for data at rest and in transit. Configure access control policies, including role-based access control (RBAC) and shared access signatures (SAS).
Define lifecycle management rules to automatically transition data between tiers and delete data after the retention period expires.
Verify the ability to upload, retrieve, and restore data from the archive tier. Test access permissions and performance metrics.
Set up monitoring for storage account metrics, such as capacity usage and access patterns. Configure alerts for unusual activity or errors.
Create detailed documentation of the storage account configuration, lifecycle policies, and security measures. Share documentation with relevant stakeholders.
Conduct training sessions for the operations team on managing archive storage, including data retrieval, monitoring, and troubleshooting.
Schedule regular audits to ensure compliance with data retention policies and security standards. Verify that lifecycle management rules are functioning as intended.
